questions.text: A patient after receiving 2 units of blood developed breathlessness. On examination pedal edema was observed, his PR is 108/min and his BP was 156/100 mmHg. Xray chest is normal. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A patient one year after ingesting concentrated NaOH comes with complete dysphagia. What should be the next step for this patient?
A 22 year old student presents with insomnia, weight loss and anxiety. On examination she is anxious and there is presence of exophthalmos. Which antibody will be high in this patient?
A patient comes with a swelling on the check, anterior and inferior to tragus. It is present for last 2 years, gradually increasing in size. What is the most probable diagnosis?
According to EHS, an inguinal hernia which is “P, L and 1.2cm is”?
A patient with peripheral arterial disease develops pain after walking 400 meters and has to take rest to get relief before he starts to walk again. According to Boyd classification this is?
True statement about primary sclerosing Cholangitis is?

options.label: A
options.text: Smoking increases the risk of PSC

options.label: B
options.text: Main antibody are AMA and ANA

options.label: C
options.text: Cholectomy in ulcerative colitis decreases the progression of PSC

options.label: D
options.text: ERCP is gold standard for Dx and it shows beaded appearance of CBD, Prune tree appearance of biliary tree.

questions.text: Mattox incision is given to mobilize?

options.label: A
options.text: Right medial rotation of ascending colon

options.label: B
options.text: Left medial rotation of descending colon

questions.text: A 39-year-old previously healthy male is hospitalized for 10 days with epigastric pain radiating to his back, nausea, and vomiting. Initial laboratory values revealed an elevated amylase level consistent with acute pancreatitis. 3 weeks later he complains of early satiety, epigastric pain, and fevers. On presentation, his temperature is 38.9°C (102°F) and his HR is 120/min his WBC count is 24,000/mm3 and his amylase level is 350IU/L. He undergoes a CT scan demonstrating a 6 cm by 6 cm rim-enhancing fluid collection in the body of the pancreas. Which of the following would be the best treatment for him?

options.label: B
options.text: Antibiotic therapy for 2 to 3 days followed by CT-guided aspiration.

options.label: D
options.text: Surgical internal drainage of the fluid collection with a cyst-gastrostomy or Roux-en-Y cysto-jejunostomy?

questions.correct_answer: C. Antibiotics and percutaneous catheter drainage

questions.text: Treatment of type IV Mirizzi syndrome is?

options.label: D
options.text: Cholecystectomy and Roux and Y hepaticojejunostomy

questions.text: In which stage of cholangiocarcinoma, cholecystectomy can be safely done?

A middle aged males with history of prone to many allergies, presents with complains of heartburn (not relieved by medicines) and intermittent dysphagia. He feels as if the food gets impacted in chest with mild chest pain. Endoscopy picture is given below. What is the most probable diagnosis?
Shouldice repair of hernia is?

options.label: A
options.text: Multilayered repair of inguinal canal by double breasting of fascia transversalis.

options.label: B
options.text: Conjoint tendon is sutured to inguinal ligament

options.label: C
options.text: Conjoint tendon is sutured to Cooper’s ligament

questions.correct_answer: A. Multilayered repair of inguinal canal by double breasting of fascia transversalis.

questions.text: False statement about anal canal cancer is?

options.label: A
options.text: Squamous cell cancer is most common type

options.label: B
options.text: SCC more common in immunocompromised patients

options.label: C
options.text: Nigro regime is the treatment of choice

options.label: D
options.text: Nigro regime consists of Radiotherapy & Chemotherapy followed by surgery

questions.correct_answer: D. Nigro regime consists of Radiotherapy & Chemotherapy followed by surgery

questions.text: String of sausage sign on angiography is seen in which type of mesenteric ischemia?
Most common organ injured in seat belt injury is?

A young boy presents with rectal bleed and found to have a rectal polyp. After colonoscopic snaring of polyp, the biopsy showed present of gland cells and mucin. What is the likely polyp type in this child?
The ulcer shown in the image is seen in?
Which organ is least likely to be involved in Alagille syndrome?

options.label: B
options.text: In molecular classification Luminal 1 has best prognosis.

options.label: D
options.text: CDH1 gene is associated with NOS type of infiltrating ductal cancer.

questions.correct_answer: D. CDH1 gene is associated with NOS type of infiltrating ductal cancer.

questions.text: A middle age man presented with frequency of urine, mild grade fever and flank pain. Urine examination revealed 20 WBC/HPF but culture was sterile. X ray image in given below. What is the most probable diagnosis?
The image shown is at the end of a surgical procedure. Identify the procedure?
No man’s land in hand injury is?

options.label: A
options.text: Close observation for the future development of medullary cancer.

options.label: C

questions.text: Name the surgical device shown in the picture?
A patient was diagnosed with Alzheimer’s disease, imaging shows significant thinning of the cerebral cortex, which of the following has led to this finding?

A 15-year-old boy with a history of recurrent transfusions for thalassemia major develops fever, chills, and back pain during a red blood cell transfusion. The symptoms occur about 2 hours into the transfusion. Which of the following will reduce the reaction in subsequent transfusion?

options.label: A
options.text: Saline washing of RBC before transfusion.

questions.text: Which of the following statements about autosomal recessive trait is true?

options.label: B
options.text: 50% chance of passing disease to offsprings.

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman presents with persistent pain and swelling in her left knee. Imaging studies reveal a well-demarcated, lobulated mass within the medullary cavity of the distal femur. Histological examination of a biopsy specimen shows small, round, blue cells forming characteristic Homer-Wright rosettes. What is the most likely diagnosis, and what immunohistochemical marker can be used for further confirmation?

options.label: D
options.text: Giant cell tumor of bone, CD68

questions.text: True about leucocyte transmigration are all except

A 25-year young student is having recurrent fainting spells and palpitations. ECG shows ventricular arrhythmias. Patients’ elder sibling died due to similar disease. What mutation is most likely to be the cause?
Ipilimumab is a monoclonal antibody against CTLA-4 it acts by

A 45-year-old woman presents with fatigue, easy bruising, and frequent infections over the past few months. Complete blood count reveals pancytopenia, and peripheral blood smear shows blasts with multiple Auer rods. Genetic examination of blasts is likely to show?

A 35-year-old woman now has a deep vein thrombus, she has a history of recurrent miscarriages, Her APTT is prolonged, but the PT is normal. What additional test should be ordered to confirm the diagnosis?

A 35-year-old male presents with hematuria, proteinuria, and hypertension. Biopsy reveal glomerulonephritis with crescent formation, IF shows linear deposits of IgG. Which is most likely pathogenesis in this patient?

A patient is diagnosed with lung cancer, and further testing reveals that the tumor cells express TTF-1 (thyroid transcription factor-1) and harbor EGFR mutations. Which histological subtype is most likely?

A 45-year-old male with a history of liver cirrhosis presents with abdominal distension and lower extremity edema. Laboratory tests reveal hypoalbuminemia. What is the primary mechanism contributing to the development of edema in this patient?

A 65-year-old patient undergoes colonoscopy, revealing a large, pedunculated polyp in the cecum. Histological examination shows branching glands with mild dysplasia what is the risk of malignancy in this patient?
The histology of a thyroid tumor is as shown in the image, what histological findings are seen in this?

True about testicular tumors are? (1) Spermatocytic tumor does not arise from Germ Cell Neoplasia Insitu (GCNIS) (2) Seminomas are positive for cytokeratin. (3) Embryonal carcinoma is more radiosensitive than seminoma. (4) Tumors derived from GCNIS are post pubertal. (5) Seminomas are negative for AFP.
Which of the following is NOT a determinant of health?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • While genetics can influence health outcomes, it is not considered a determinant of health as it is beyond an individual's control.

questions.text: What is herd immunity?

options.label: A
options.text: Immunity acquired through vaccination or previous infection

options.label: B
options.text: Immunity achieved when a large proportion of the population is vaccinated

options.label: D
options.text: Immunity only acquired through genetic factors

questions.correct_answer: B. Immunity achieved when a large proportion of the population is vaccinated

questions.text: What is the primary focus of primary prevention in public health?

options.label: A
options.text: Screening for early detection of diseases

options.label: C
options.text: Preventing diseases from occurring in the first place

questions.correct_answer: C. Preventing diseases from occurring in the first place

questions.text: Which of the following phases of disaster management involves measures taken to prevent the impact of disasters before they occur?
Which of the following is an example of an ergonomic hazard in the workplace?
How can knowledge of genetic predispositions contribute to public health interventions?

options.label: A
options.text: By promoting genetic modification of populations.

options.label: B
options.text: By identifying individuals at higher risk for certain diseases.

options.label: C
options.text: By excluding individuals with genetic conditions from healthcare.

options.label: D
options.text: By encouraging discrimination against individuals with genetic predispositions.

questions.correct_answer: B. By identifying individuals at higher risk for certain diseases.

questions.text: Which of the following factors is NOT considered in the calculation of the GHI?
Which study design is often used to generate hypotheses and explore associations between exposures and outcomes?
Which study design examines the association between exposures and outcomes at the population level rather than the individual level?
Which coefficient indicates a perfect negative linear relationship between two variables?
Which statistical test is used to compare the means of two independent groups?
Which of the following methods is commonly used to assess blood pressure tracking over time?
Which if the following is the RDA (ug/ day) for Iodine in pregnant females as per the NIN 2024 Updates?
Which organ is most commonly affected by endemic dropsy?
What is the target population of the Home-Based Post Neonatal Care Program?
Warfarin dose to be increased if the patient is taking warfarin along with
Which of the following drugs has no role in thyrotoxic crisis?
Which of the following indicates action of aripiprazole with relation to its effects of D2 receptor?
Which of the drugs useful in gout contraindicated in patient with G6PD deficiency?
Which of the following drugs useful orally for treating hypotension followed by haemodialysis?

A patient presents with an upper respiratory infection often accompanied by proteinuria and persistent asymptomatic microscopic haematuria, diagnosed as IgA nephropathy. Which of the following agent recently approved for managing this condition?
Anti arrhythmic agent useful in myotonia congenita is

A 30 year old woman was hospitalized for ileo femoral thrombosis (DVT). She was immediately started on parenteral anticoagulant (drug A), monitored by aPTT. 4days later, she developed bleeding, complete blood count revealed thrombocytopenia. Drag A was replaced with another parenteral anticoagulant (drug B). Drug B is most probably
Which drug used to prevent allograft rejection can cause hyperlipidemia?

A 60-year-old woman presents to the hospital with shortness of breath, fever, and malaise. She has a history of breast cancer and is receiving chemotherapy. Her chest x-ray shows pneumonia, and respiratory cultures are positive for Aspergillus fumigatus. Which is the MOST appropriate choice for treatment?

A 4-year-old boy is brought to the OPD due to high fever, nasal discharge, and cough for 3 days. Physical examination shows an ill-appearing, febrile child. The patient has bilateral conjunctival injection and several small white spots with an erythematous base on his buccal mucosa as shown in the image. A review of the medical record shows parental refusal of preventive health services in favor of a "natural" approach to the child's health. Over the next several days, which of the following is most likely to develop?

A previously healthy 27-year-old man comes to the clinic due to fever and rash. Four days ago, he developed a high fever and malaise followed by the appearance of multiple discrete macules on his face, trunk, and extremities. The lesions are pruritic and evolved into pustules then vesicles. The patient has continued to develop new vesicles as other lesions crust over and heal. The remainder of the examination is unremarkable. This patient’s symptoms are most likely due to an infection with which of the following pathogens?

A 40-year-old homeless alcoholic has a fever and is coughing up 1 cup of green, foul-smelling sputum per day. You suspect that he may have a lung abscess. Which one of the following pairs of organisms is MOST likely to be the cause?
All the following zoonotic illness has arthropod vector EXCEPT

A 30-year-old woman with systemic lupus erythematosus is found to have a positive serologic test for syphilis (VDRL test). She denies having had sexual contact with a partner who had symptoms of a venereal disease. The next best step would be to:

options.label: A
options.text: Reassure her that the test is a false-positive reaction related to her autoimmune disorder

options.label: B
options.text: Trace her sexual contacts for serologic testing

options.label: D
options.text: Perform a fluorescent treponemal antibody-absorbed (FTAABS) test on a specimen of her serum

questions.correct_answer: D. Perform a fluorescent treponemal antibody-absorbed (FTAABS) test on a specimen of her serum

questions.text: A 24-year-old woman comes to the emergency department due to fevers and chills over the last 24 hours. Three weeks ago, she underwent a partial bowel resection for Crohn disease without complications. Since the surgery, the patient has had difficulty eating and has a peripherally inserted central venous catheter in place through which she is receiving parenteral nutrition. Her temperature is 38.2 deg C, blood pressure is 100/60 mm Hg, and pulse is 114/mm. The surgical wound healed well and her abdomen is soft and nontender. The catheter site on the left arm is mildly tender but shows no erythema. Chest x-ray reveals a properly positioned central venous line and is otherwise unremarkable. Admission blood cultures subsequently return positive for yeast. Which of the following is characteristic of the most likely organism causing this bloodstream infection?

A 6-year-old male is brought to the pediatric emergency room with fever and sore throat. The parents tell you that the child has not received any immunizations. Physical exam reveals a grey pharyngeal exudate and Gram stain shows scanty Gram-positive organisms. Which of the following culture types would facilitate the growth of this organism?

A 42-year-old woman presents to her physician with complaints of fatigue and chronic joint pain. The pain is most severe in her hands and knees bilaterally. She has taken acetaminophen without relief. Further questioning reveals she experiences intense joint stiffness in the mornings, but the stiffness Improves with use. A positive test for which of the following autoantibodies would confirm the most likely diagnosis?

A HIV-infected patient develops profuse, watery diarrhea. His physician collects stool specimens for parasitology examination. Stool acid fast stain shown in the image. Which organism most likely responsible for these infections?
Choose the appropriate selective medium for the cultivation of Leishmania

options.label: B
options.text: BERA is an objective test of hearing

options.label: C
options.text: Cortical deafness is easily diagnosed by BERA

options.label: D
options.text: BERA is abnormal in deafness due to auditory neuropathy

questions.correct_answer: C. Cortical deafness is easily diagnosed by BERA

What is true about auditory neuropathy?
Not true about benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV)

options.label: A
options.text: Displacement of otoliths from macula is the aetiology

options.label: B
options.text: Particle repositioning maneuver is the treatment modality

options.label: C
options.text: Horizontal semicircular canal is most commonly involved in bppv

options.label: D
options.text: The typical nystagmus on dix – hallpike’s test is geotropic and fatiguable

questions.correct_answer: C. Horizontal semicircular canal is most commonly involved in bppv

questions.text: Match the following considering “Benjamin and Inglis classification of laryngeal clefts”

Rakesh, 32 year old, male gives history of ear discharge foul smelling and occasionally blood stained for last 6 years. He also complains of hearing loss for last 2 years. For last 3 days patient has developed fever with chills and oedema over mastoid region. Correlate the given images and choose the most appropraite diagnosis is?

options.label: C
options.text: Atticoantral CSOM with Lateral sinus thrombosis.

questions.text: Which are false?

options.label: A
options.text: Dacryocystorhinostomy (DCR) can be done in chronic dacryocystitis

options.label: B
options.text: Maxillary and ethmoid bones are removed in dacryocystorhinostomy (DCR) surgery in medial orbit as they form lacrimal fossa

questions.correct_answer: B. Maxillary and ethmoid bones are removed in dacryocystorhinostomy (DCR) surgery in medial orbit as they form lacrimal fossa

questions.text: Which retina layer has synapses?

A one-month old baby was brought to clinic with complain of having large looking eyes. Clinical examination shows normal tear passages and clear cornea. Examintaion under anaestheia revealed IOP of 18m Hg in both eyes. The most likely diagnosis is:
True for this surgery are all of the following except

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: It is needed for central serous retinopathy

options.label: C
options.text: One probe has the light source and other cutter

questions.correct_answer: B. It is needed for central serous retinopathy

questions.text: 65-year-old man underwent cataract surgery with placement of a posterior chamber IOL. He presents 2 years later with blurred vision. On examination, there was plaque seen on focusing the slit lamp on to the posterior surface of IOL. There was no view of posterior segment. Ultrasound B scan was done and was found to be normal. The cause for this condition can be due to:
Which extraocular muscle is inserted ahead the centre of rotation and when it contracts, the anterior portion of the eye is adducted and intorted.
Which is incorrect regarding left eye here?

options.label: A
options.text: There is weakness or disinsertion of the levator palpebrae superioris from the anterior surface of the tarsus

options.label: B
options.text: There will be decreased levator action

options.label: C
options.text: The eyelid will not follow the eyeball during downgaze

options.label: D
options.text: Levator muscle resection is one of treatment modalities

questions.correct_answer: A. There is weakness or disinsertion of the levator palpebrae superioris from the anterior surface of the tarsus

questions.text: Which is correct for the condition shown?

options.label: A
options.text: It is generally seen in Ocular hypertension

options.label: C
options.text: Laser iridotomy is useful in this

questions.correct_answer: C. Laser iridotomy is useful in this

questions.text: Which is incorrect for the test being done?

options.label: A
options.text: It is used to assess comitant squint

options.label: B
options.text: It is positive in blow out fracture

questions.correct_answer: A. It is used to assess comitant squint

questions.text: True for the following condition are all except

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: D. Occurs usually in young women, is often unilateral and associated with absent knee-jerks

questions.text: A term baby weighing 1kg was born to a 20 yrs old mother. The baby was found to have petechiae, hepatosplenomegaly and thrombocytopenia. Following is his CT image. These features are seen in which congenital infection?
Which vaccine should be recommended to a 10 yrs old child?

A preterm infant born at 25 weeks' gestation is now 6 weeks old (3 1 weeks corrected gestational age) . The infant has been stable for the past few weeks, breathing in room air, and receiving full enteral feedings through gavage tube that consist of fortified maternal breastmilk and some formula supplementation. Yesterday the infant had a few large gastric residuals with feeding but otherwise seemed well. You are called to the bedside today because of increased abdominal distention, apneic spells, poor urine output, lethargy, and hypothermia. This constellation of findings is most concerning for what condition?

A mother presents to labor and delivery at 39 weeks' gestation for a scheduled induction due to poorly controlled gestational diabetes. She has required insulin since the 29th week and reports that most of her blood glucose readings have been greater than 200 mg/dL over the past 2 weeks. She progresses in labor after oxytocin induction and vaginally delivers a single male infant weighing 4500 g. This infant is at increased risk for which of the following problems in the days following delivery?

options.label: B
options.text: Respiratory distress syndrome of the newborn.

questions.text: You are evaluating an infant in the newborn nursery who was born weighing 2.0kg at 39-5/7 weeks' gestational age. The infant has small eyes with drooping upper eyelids, a flat philtrum, micrognathia, thin upper lip, and a short upturned nose. During pregnancy, the infant was most likely exposed to what substance?
Regarding IV fluids, what are the components of lactated Ringer's solution?

options.label: A
options.text: Na+ 154 mEq/L, K+ 4 mEq/L, Cl- 1 58 mEq/L, lactate 3 g/L.

options.label: B
options.text: Na+ 130, K+ 4, Ca2+ 2.7 mEq/L, Cl- 109, lactate 28 mEq/L.

questions.correct_answer: B. Na+ 130, K+ 4, Ca2+ 2.7 mEq/L, Cl- 109, lactate 28 mEq/L.

questions.text: It is June in Rajasthan, and a 9-day-old girl is brought to an urgent care facility for evaluation because she has not been feeding well for several days. She has solely been breastfed. There is no other bothersome history: No fever, no rash, no exposure to ill persons, no concerning information. The urgent care physician is worried when she sees the neonate and sends her to the emergency department (ED) for treatment. In the ED she appears tired but not truly lethargic in the medical sense; an IV line is placed, blood is obtained for laboratory studies, and she is given a 20 mL/kg normal saline bolus. After obtaining the history, the ED physician decides that the neonate would be best served by admission, and you, as the pediatrician on call, agree to take over her care. She improves following fluid administration in the ED, but when you arrive shortly thereafter, you are told that her serum sodium is 165 mEq/L. She appears well and her vital signs are within normal limits; the only other exam finding of note is mild jaundice. Her mother tells you that her birthweight was 3.5 kg, and you notice that her weight in triage was 3.0 kg. The child's mother also asks if it is normal for the child to sweat while feeding, as she has done occasionally since birth. What most likely is the principal cause of this child's hypernatremia (serum sodium > 145 mEq/L) ?
questions.correct_answer: C. Poor feeding leading to dehydration.

questions.text: What findings would be expected if a child has hypernatremia due to X linked recessive diabetes Insipidus (DI)?

options.label: A
options.text: High serum osmolality, low urine osmolality.

options.label: B
options.text: Low serum osmolality, low urine osmolality.

options.label: C
options.text: High serum osmolality, high urine osmolality.

options.label: D
options.text: Low serum osmolality, high urine osmolality.

questions.correct_answer: A. High serum osmolality, low urine osmolality.

questions.text: A 6-week-old breastfed male infant presents with nonbilious, nonbloody projectile emesis with progressive worsening and recent weight loss. He has been afebrile without diarrhea. He eats voraciously then vomits, only to want to eat again. The most likely diagnosis is:
Liddle syndrome is characterized by each of the following except:
In a case of hypoxemia, Alveolar-arterial gradient (PAO2-PaO2) is normal. ABG also reveals high PaCO2 with respiratory acidosis. The most probable mechanism involved is
A 40 year old man presented with recurrent episodes of wheezing and hemoptysis. CXR shows perihilar bronchiectasis. The most likely diagnosis is

63 years gentleman, chronic smoker had a 3 year history of cough with intermittent episodes of fever and breathlessness. CXR revealed prominent Broncho-vesicular markings with Cardiomegaly. Recently he reports weight loss of 6kg in last 2 months. On examination, there is Grade 3 clubbing. What is the most probable diagnosis :
Identify the true statement regarding Dengue vaccine

options.label: A
options.text: It is a Trivalent live vaccine

options.label: B
options.text: It is administered as a single dose

options.label: C
options.text: It is indicated in patients with a positive serology indicating prior dengue infection

options.label: D
options.text: It is best given in childhood before the exposure to dengue infection

questions.correct_answer: C. It is indicated in patients with a positive serology indicating prior dengue infection

questions.text: A 75-year-old man presents with development of abdominal obesity, proximal myopathy, and skin hyperpigmentation. His laboratory evaluation shows a hypokalemic metabolic alkalosis. Which of the following statements regarding this syndrome is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Basal ACTH level is likely to be low.

options.label: B
options.text: Circulating corticotropin-releasing hormone is likely to be elevated.

options.label: C
options.text: Pituitary magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) will visualize all ACTH-secreting tumors.

options.label: D
options.text: Serum potassium level <3.3 mmol/L is suggestive of ectopic ACTH production.

questions.correct_answer: D. Serum potassium level <3.3 mmol/L is suggestive of ectopic ACTH production.

questions.text: A 45-year-old man reports to his primary care physician that his wife has noted coarsening of his facial features over several years. In addition, he reports low libido and decreased energy. Physical examination shows frontal bossing and enlarged hands. An MRI confirms that he has a pituitary mass. Which of the following screening tests should be ordered to diagnose the cause of the mass?
questions.correct_answer: D. Serum insulin-like growth factor-1 (IGF-1) level

questions.text: A 22-year-old woman who is otherwise healthy undergoes an uneventful vaginal delivery of a full term infant. One day postpartum, she complains of visual changes and severe headache. Two hours after these complaints, she is found unresponsive and profoundly hypotensive. She is intubated and placed on mechanical ventilation. Her blood pressure is 68/28 mmHg, regular heart rate is 148 bpm, her oxygen saturation is 95% on fraction of inspired oxygen (FiO2) of 0.40. Physical exam is unremarkable. Her laboratory tests are notable for glucose of 49 mg/dL, with normal hematocrit and white blood cell count. Which of the following is most likely to reverse her hypotension?

options.label: A
options.text: Transfusion of packed red blood cells

questions.text: A middle-aged female presented with angina. Coronary Angiography revealed normal vessels. This finding is possible in following conditions EXCEPT:

On examination, there is reduced air entry and dullness on percussion in the right lung. A diagnostic pleural tap was performed and aspirate sent for analysis. The result reveals a Serum to Pleural fluid albumin gradient of 1.1. From the given list, select the most likely diagnosis:

The wife of a 48-year-old male patient brings him to the emergency room and says that his memory has progressively gotten worse over the last several years. She also says his personality has been changing. The physician notes abnormal writhing movements of the man's limbs and hyperreactive reflexes. MRI reveals a loss of volume in the neostriatum and cortex. This disease is inherited as a __________trait?

A 9-yr-old girl has difficulty in combing hairs and climbing upstairs since 6 months. She has a maculopapular rash over metacarpophalangeal joints. What should be the next appropriate investigation to be done?

He is non-alcoholic and denies any history of head trauma in the past. Inferior gaze is affected on evaluation. MRI was performed. The most likely diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: RNA polymerase I produces mainly messenger RNA (mRNA)

options.label: B
options.text: RNA polymerase III produces ribosomal RNA (rRNA)

options.label: C
options.text: RNA polymerase II produces transfer RNA (tRNA)

questions.text: Which of the following mechanisms is used to establish the mitochondrial electrochemical gradient?

options.label: B
options.text: Pumping of protons into the mitochondrial matrix by respiratory chain activity

options.label: C
options.text: Transport of ATP out of the matrix compartment by a specific transporter

options.label: D
options.text: Proton-translocating activity in the inner membrane

questions.correct_answer: D. Proton-translocating activity in the inner membrane

questions.text: Xantheurenic acid in the urine is suggestive of deficiency of which vitamin?

A 35-year-old woman comes to her physician complaining of difficulty in walking. On questioning, the patient indicates she had trouble walking for 5 days last month and also that she has experienced pain and prickly sensations that come and go, as well as occasional muscle weakness. Vital Signs: T 36.5°C, P 70/min, R 15/min, BP 124/80 mm Hg, BMI 27. Muscle strength testing: Normal. Deep tendon reflexes: Normal. When asked to walk, the patient had difficulty in balancing and maintaining a normal gait. Patellar tendon reflexes were normal. The muscles, however, were weak. LABORATORY STUDIES- MRI indicated Gd-enhancing brain lesions, as well as one infratentorial lesion and three periventricular lesions in the brain. Analysis of cerebrospinal fluid showed an oligoclonal IgG band. During the initial stages of this disease, how would the velocity of action potential transmission be altered within the central nervous system?

options.label: A
options.text: Myelinated axons would show a decreased conduction velocity, and unmyelinated axons would show an increased conduction velocity.

options.label: B
options.text: Myelinated axons would show an increased conduction velocity, and unmyelinated axons would show a decreased conduction velocity.

options.label: C
options.text: Myelinated axons would show an increased conduction velocity, and unmyelinated axons would show an increased conduction velocity.

options.label: D
options.text: Myelinated axons would show a decreased conduction velocity, and unmyelinated axons would show no change in conduction velocity.

questions.text: A 68-year-old man comes to the physician’s office complaining of trembling in his hands and difficulty walking. Neurologic examination shows the patient has a resting tremor of the left hand that diminishes when performing a task. During passive movement of the left arm, the muscles are rigid, causing “cogwheel” motion during stretching. The patient’s facial expressions are reduced. When walking, the patient has difficulty taking the first step but then is able to walk smoothly with a shuffling gait. These symptoms are consistent with damage to which of the following?

The following events occurred during the course of fever in a 12-year-old boy: (1) cutaneous vasodilation and sweating; (2) return of the set-point temperature to normal; (3) increase in the set-point temperature; (4) shivering, chills, cutaneous vasoconstriction. Which of the following is the correct sequence of events during the course of fever in this boy?
A/E the following factors increase the cerebral blood flow-

options.label: C
options.text: Increased activity of the cortical neurons

options.label: D
options.text: Decrease in arterial blood pressure from 120 mm to 90 mm Hg

questions.correct_answer: D. Decrease in arterial blood pressure from 120 mm to 90 mm Hg

questions.text: A male medical practitioner has a consensual sexual intercourse with his married female patient. He can be punished by NMC by all except

questions.correct_answer: C. By imprisonment for 5 years and/ or fine

questions.correct_answer: C. A and C are correct

questions.text: A 62 year old female sustained colles’ fracture 10 weeks ago. She was kept in immobilisation in cast since then till 2 days ago. As the cast was removed she complained of severe pain in wrist and hyperaesthesia. All of the following are true about this except :

options.text: It’s a clinical diagnosis where X-rays are usually Normal
